alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 7:35AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Brief Mixed Precipitation This Morning... Showers will impact northwestern Pennsylvania through 9 AM. These showers are falling as a mix of rain, freezing rain and wet snow. Precipitation amounts will be light and showers will exit quickly over the next hour or so. Temperatures remain in the upper 20s and lower 30s along and east of I-79 with sensors indicating pavement temperatures near or just below freezing. This can allow untreated surfaces to turn slick where precipitation amounts are enough to wet paved surfaces. Bridges and overpasses will be most prone. Motorists should be prepared for briefly slick road conditions as these showers move through. Roads that appear wet may be icy. Conditions will quickly improve later this morning once the showers exit.
